# HELP scylla_alien_receive_batch_queue_length Current receive batch queue length
# TYPE scylla_alien_receive_batch_queue_length gauge
scylla_alien_receive_batch_queue_length{shard="0",type="queue_length"} 0.000000
scylla_alien_receive_batch_queue_length{shard="1",type="queue_length"} 0.000000
scylla_alien_receive_batch_queue_length{shard="2",type="queue_length"} 0.000000
scylla_alien_receive_batch_queue_length{shard="3",type="queue_length"} 0.000000

# HELP scylla_batchlog_manager_total_write_replay_attempts Counts write operations issued in a batchlog replay flow. The high value of this metric indicates that we have a long batch replay list.
# TYPE scylla_batchlog_manager_total_write_replay_attempts counter
scylla_batchlog_manager_total_write_replay_attempts{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_batchlog_manager_total_write_replay_attempts{shard="1",type="derive"} 0

scylla_batchlog_manager_total_write_replay_attempts{shard="3",type="derive"} 0

# HELP scylla_commitlog_alloc Counts a number of times a new mutation has been added to a segment. Divide bytes_written by this value to get the average number of bytes per mutation written to the disk.
# TYPE scylla_commitlog_alloc counter
scylla_commitlog_alloc{shard="0",type="derive"} 21
scylla_commitlog_alloc{shard="1",type="derive"} 68
scylla_commitlog_alloc{shard="2",type="derive"} 131
scylla_commitlog_alloc{shard="3",type="derive"} 159
# HELP scylla_commitlog_allocating_segments Holds the number of not closed segments that still have some free space. This value should not get too high.
# TYPE scylla_commitlog_allocating_segments gauge
scylla_commitlog_allocating_segments{shard="0",type="gauge"} 1.000000
scylla_commitlog_allocating_segments{shard="1",type="gauge"} 1.000000
scylla_commitlog_allocating_segments{shard="2",type="gauge"} 1.000000
scylla_commitlog_allocating_segments{shard="3",type="gauge"} 1.000000
# HELP scylla_commitlog_bytes_written Counts a number of bytes written to the disk. Divide this value by "alloc" to get the average number of bytes per mutation written to the disk.
# TYPE scylla_commitlog_bytes_written counter
scylla_commitlog_bytes_written{shard="0",type="derive"} 20480
scylla_commitlog_bytes_written{shard="1",type="derive"} 45056
scylla_commitlog_bytes_written{shard="2",type="derive"} 98304
scylla_commitlog_bytes_written{shard="3",type="derive"} 106496
# HELP scylla_commitlog_cycle Counts a number of commitlog write cycles - when the data is written from the internal memory buffer to the disk.
# TYPE scylla_commitlog_cycle counter
scylla_commitlog_cycle{shard="0",type="derive"} 3
scylla_commitlog_cycle{shard="1",type="derive"} 2
scylla_commitlog_cycle{shard="2",type="derive"} 1
scylla_commitlog_cycle{shard="3",type="derive"} 1
# HELP scylla_commitlog_disk_total_bytes Holds a size of disk space in bytes used for data so far. A too high value indicates that we have some bottleneck in the writing to sstables path.
# TYPE scylla_commitlog_disk_total_bytes gauge
scylla_commitlog_disk_total_bytes{shard="0",type="gauge"} 393216.000000
scylla_commitlog_disk_total_bytes{shard="1",type="gauge"} 262144.000000
scylla_commitlog_disk_total_bytes{shard="2",type="gauge"} 131072.000000
scylla_commitlog_disk_total_bytes{shard="3",type="gauge"} 131072.000000
# HELP scylla_commitlog_flush Counts a number of times the flush() method was called for a file.
# TYPE scylla_commitlog_flush counter
scylla_commitlog_flush{shard="0",type="derive"} 3
scylla_commitlog_flush{shard="1",type="derive"} 2
scylla_commitlog_flush{shard="2",type="derive"} 1
scylla_commitlog_flush{shard="3",type="derive"} 1
# HELP scylla_commitlog_flush_limit_exceeded Counts a number of times a flush limit was exceeded. A non-zero value indicates that there are too many pending flush operations (see pending_flushes) and some of them will be blocked till the total amount of pending flush operations drops below 5.
# TYPE scylla_commitlog_flush_limit_exceeded counter
scylla_commitlog_flush_limit_exceeded{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_commitlog_flush_limit_exceeded{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_commitlog_flush_limit_exceeded{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_commitlog_flush_limit_exceeded{shard="3",type="derive"} 0

# TYPE scylla_commitlog_memory_buffer_bytes gauge
scylla_commitlog_memory_buffer_bytes{shard="0",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_commitlog_memory_buffer_bytes{shard="1",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_commitlog_memory_buffer_bytes{shard="2",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_commitlog_memory_buffer_bytes{shard="3",type="gauge"} 0.000000
# HELP scylla_commitlog_pending_allocations Holds a number of currently pending allocations. A non-zero value indicates that we have a bottleneck in the disk write flow.
# TYPE scylla_commitlog_pending_allocations gauge
scylla_commitlog_pending_allocations{shard="0",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_commitlog_pending_allocations{shard="1",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_commitlog_pending_allocations{shard="2",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_commitlog_pending_allocations{shard="3",type="gauge"} 0.000000

# TYPE scylla_commitlog_pending_flushes gauge
scylla_commitlog_pending_flushes{shard="0",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_commitlog_pending_flushes{shard="1",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_commitlog_pending_flushes{shard="2",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_commitlog_pending_flushes{shard="3",type="gauge"} 0.000000
# HELP scylla_commitlog_requests_blocked_memory Counts a number of requests blocked due to memory pressure. A non-zero value indicates that the commitlog memory quota is not enough to serve the required amount of requests.
# TYPE scylla_commitlog_requests_blocked_memory counter
scylla_commitlog_requests_blocked_memory{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_commitlog_requests_blocked_memory{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_commitlog_requests_blocked_memory{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_commitlog_requests_blocked_memory{shard="3",type="derive"} 0

scylla_commitlog_segments{shard="1",type="gauge"} 1.000000
scylla_commitlog_segments{shard="2",type="gauge"} 1.000000
scylla_commitlog_segments{shard="3",type="gauge"} 1.000000
# HELP scylla_commitlog_slack Counts a number of unused bytes written to the disk due to disk segment alignment.
# TYPE scylla_commitlog_slack counter
scylla_commitlog_slack{shard="0",type="derive"} 7691
scylla_commitlog_slack{shard="1",type="derive"} 5157
scylla_commitlog_slack{shard="2",type="derive"} 29
scylla_commitlog_slack{shard="3",type="derive"} 684

# TYPE scylla_commitlog_unused_segments gauge
scylla_commitlog_unused_segments{shard="0",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_commitlog_unused_segments{shard="1",type="gauge"} 0.000000

scylla_cql_deletes{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_cql_deletes{shard="3",type="derive"} 0
# HELP scylla_cql_filtered_read_requests Counts a total number of CQL read requests that required ALLOW FILTERING. See filtered_rows_read_total to compare how many rows needed to be filtered.
# TYPE scylla_cql_filtered_read_requests counter
scylla_cql_filtered_read_requests{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_cql_filtered_read_requests{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_cql_filtered_read_requests{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_cql_filtered_read_requests{shard="3",type="derive"} 0
# HELP scylla_cql_filtered_rows_dropped_total Counts a number of rows read during CQL requests that required ALLOW FILTERING and dropped by the filter. Number similar to filtered_rows_read_total indicates that filtering is not accurate and might cause performance degradation.
# TYPE scylla_cql_filtered_rows_dropped_total counter
scylla_cql_filtered_rows_dropped_total{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_cql_filtered_rows_dropped_total{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_cql_filtered_rows_dropped_total{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_cql_filtered_rows_dropped_total{shard="3",type="derive"} 0
# HELP scylla_cql_filtered_rows_matched_total Counts a number of rows read during CQL requests that required ALLOW FILTERING and accepted by the filter. Number similar to filtered_rows_read_total indicates that filtering is accurate.
# TYPE scylla_cql_filtered_rows_matched_total counter
scylla_cql_filtered_rows_matched_total{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_cql_filtered_rows_matched_total{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_cql_filtered_rows_matched_total{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_cql_filtered_rows_matched_total{shard="3",type="derive"} 0
# HELP scylla_cql_filtered_rows_read_total Counts a total number of rows read during CQL requests that required ALLOW FILTERING. See filtered_rows_matched_total and filtered_rows_dropped_total for information how accurate filtering queries are.
# TYPE scylla_cql_filtered_rows_read_total counter
scylla_cql_filtered_rows_read_total{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_cql_filtered_rows_read_total{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_cql_filtered_rows_read_total{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_cql_filtered_rows_read_total{shard="3",type="derive"} 0

scylla_database_active_reads{class="system",shard="0",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_database_active_reads{class="user",shard="0",type="gauge"} 0.000000

scylla_database_active_reads{class="system",shard="1",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_database_active_reads{class="user",shard="1",type="gauge"} 0.000000

scylla_database_active_reads{class="system",shard="3",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_database_active_reads{class="user",shard="3",type="gauge"} 0.000000
# HELP scylla_database_active_reads_memory_consumption Holds the amount of memory consumed by currently active read operations. If this value gets close to 2474639 we are likely to start dropping new read requests. In that case sstable_read_queue_overloads is going to get a non-zero value.
# TYPE scylla_database_active_reads_memory_consumption gauge
scylla_database_active_reads_memory_consumption{class="streaming",shard="0",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_database_active_reads_memory_consumption{class="system",shard="0",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_database_active_reads_memory_consumption{class="user",shard="0",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_database_active_reads_memory_consumption{class="streaming",shard="1",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_database_active_reads_memory_consumption{class="system",shard="1",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_database_active_reads_memory_consumption{class="user",shard="1",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_database_active_reads_memory_consumption{class="streaming",shard="2",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_database_active_reads_memory_consumption{class="system",shard="2",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_database_active_reads_memory_consumption{class="user",shard="2",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_database_active_reads_memory_consumption{class="streaming",shard="3",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_database_active_reads_memory_consumption{class="system",shard="3",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_database_active_reads_memory_consumption{class="user",shard="3",type="gauge"} 0.000000
# HELP scylla_database_clustering_filter_count Counts bloom filter invocations.
# TYPE scylla_database_clustering_filter_count counter
scylla_database_clustering_filter_count{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_clustering_filter_count{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_clustering_filter_count{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_clustering_filter_count{shard="3",type="derive"} 0
# HELP scylla_database_clustering_filter_fast_path_count Counts number of times bloom filtering short cut to include all sstables when only one full range was specified.
# TYPE scylla_database_clustering_filter_fast_path_count counter
scylla_database_clustering_filter_fast_path_count{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_clustering_filter_fast_path_count{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_clustering_filter_fast_path_count{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_clustering_filter_fast_path_count{shard="3",type="derive"} 0
# HELP scylla_database_clustering_filter_sstables_checked Counts sstables checked after applying the bloom filter. High value indicates that bloom filter is not very efficient.
# TYPE scylla_database_clustering_filter_sstables_checked counter
scylla_database_clustering_filter_sstables_checked{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_clustering_filter_sstables_checked{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_clustering_filter_sstables_checked{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_clustering_filter_sstables_checked{shard="3",type="derive"} 0
# HELP scylla_database_clustering_filter_surviving_sstables Counts sstables that survived the clustering key filtering. High value indicates that bloom filter is not very efficient and still have to access a lot of sstables to get data.
# TYPE scylla_database_clustering_filter_surviving_sstables counter
scylla_database_clustering_filter_surviving_sstables{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_clustering_filter_surviving_sstables{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_clustering_filter_surviving_sstables{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_clustering_filter_surviving_sstables{shard="3",type="derive"} 0

# HELP scylla_database_paused_reads_permit_based_evictions The number of paused reads evicted to free up permits. Permits are required for new reads to start, and the database will evict paused reads (if any) to be able to admit new ones, if there is a shortage of permits.
# TYPE scylla_database_paused_reads_permit_based_evictions counter
scylla_database_paused_reads_permit_based_evictions{class="streaming",shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_paused_reads_permit_based_evictions{class="system",shard="0",type="derive"} 0

scylla_database_paused_reads_permit_based_evictions{class="system",shard="1",type="derive"} 0

scylla_database_paused_reads_permit_based_evictions{class="streaming",shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_paused_reads_permit_based_evictions{class="system",shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_paused_reads_permit_based_evictions{class="user",shard="2",type="derive"} 0

# HELP scylla_database_querier_cache_resource_based_evictions Counts querier cache entries that were evicted to free up resources (limited by reader concurency limits) necessary to create new readers.
# TYPE scylla_database_querier_cache_resource_based_evictions counter
scylla_database_querier_cache_resource_based_evictions{shard="0",type="derive"} 0

# TYPE scylla_database_querier_cache_time_based_evictions counter
scylla_database_querier_cache_time_based_evictions{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_querier_cache_time_based_evictions{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_querier_cache_time_based_evictions{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_querier_cache_time_based_evictions{shard="3",type="derive"} 0

# HELP scylla_database_requests_blocked_memory Holds the current number of requests blocked due to reaching the memory quota (27839692B). Non-zero value indicates that our bottleneck is memory and more specifically - the memory quota allocated for the "database" component.
# TYPE scylla_database_requests_blocked_memory counter
scylla_database_requests_blocked_memory{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_requests_blocked_memory{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_requests_blocked_memory{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_requests_blocked_memory{shard="3",type="derive"} 0
# HELP scylla_database_requests_blocked_memory_current Holds the current number of requests blocked due to reaching the memory quota (27839692B). Non-zero value indicates that our bottleneck is memory and more specifically - the memory quota allocated for the "database" component.
# TYPE scylla_database_requests_blocked_memory_current gauge
scylla_database_requests_blocked_memory_current{shard="0",type="gauge"} 0.000000

scylla_database_requests_blocked_memory_current{shard="2",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_database_requests_blocked_memory_current{shard="3",type="gauge"} 0.000000

# HELP scylla_database_sstable_read_queue_overloads Counts the number of times the sstable read queue was overloaded. A non-zero value indicates that we have to drop read requests because they arrive faster than we can serve them.
# TYPE scylla_database_sstable_read_queue_overloads counter
scylla_database_sstable_read_queue_overloads{shard="0",type="derive"} 0

# HELP scylla_database_total_reads Counts the total number of successful reads on this shard.
# TYPE scylla_database_total_reads counter
scylla_database_total_reads{shard="0",type="derive"} 206
scylla_database_total_reads{shard="1",type="derive"} 47
scylla_database_total_reads{shard="2",type="derive"} 262
scylla_database_total_reads{shard="3",type="derive"} 123
# HELP scylla_database_total_reads_failed Counts the total number of failed read operations. Add the total_reads to this value to get the total amount of reads issued on this shard.
# TYPE scylla_database_total_reads_failed counter
scylla_database_total_reads_failed{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_total_reads_failed{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_total_reads_failed{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_total_reads_failed{shard="3",type="derive"} 0

# TYPE scylla_database_total_writes counter

scylla_database_total_writes{shard="2",type="derive"} 131
scylla_database_total_writes{shard="3",type="derive"} 159
# HELP scylla_database_total_writes_failed Counts the total number of failed write operations. A sum of this value plus total_writes represents a total amount of writes attempted on this shard.
# TYPE scylla_database_total_writes_failed counter
scylla_database_total_writes_failed{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_total_writes_failed{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_total_writes_failed{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_total_writes_failed{shard="3",type="derive"} 0
# HELP scylla_database_total_writes_timedout Counts write operations failed due to a timeout. A positive value is a sign of storage being overloaded.
# TYPE scylla_database_total_writes_timedout counter
scylla_database_total_writes_timedout{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_total_writes_timedout{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_total_writes_timedout{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_database_total_writes_timedout{shard="3",type="derive"} 0

scylla_io_queue_total_operations{class="memtable_flush",ioshard="3",mountpoint="none",shard="3",type="derive"} 176

# HELP scylla_memory_dirty_bytes Holds the current size of all ("regular", "system" and "streaming") non-free memory in bytes: used memory + released memory that hasn't been returned to a free memory pool yet. Total memory size minus this value represents the amount of available memory. If this value minus virtual_dirty_bytes is too high then this means that the dirty memory eviction lags behind.
# TYPE scylla_memory_dirty_bytes gauge
scylla_memory_dirty_bytes{shard="0",type="gauge"} 262144.000000
scylla_memory_dirty_bytes{shard="1",type="gauge"} 262144.000000
scylla_memory_dirty_bytes{shard="2",type="gauge"} 917504.000000
scylla_memory_dirty_bytes{shard="3",type="gauge"} 1048576.000000

# HELP scylla_reactor_cpu_steal_time_ms Total steal time, the time in which some other process was running while Seastar was not trying to run (not sleeping).Because this is in userspace, some time that could be legitimally thought as steal time is not accounted as such. For example, if we are sleeping and can wake up but the kernel hasn't woken us up yet.
# TYPE scylla_reactor_cpu_steal_time_ms counter
scylla_reactor_cpu_steal_time_ms{shard="0",type="derive"} 18446744073671289578
scylla_reactor_cpu_steal_time_ms{shard="1",type="derive"} 18446744073701041616
scylla_reactor_cpu_steal_time_ms{shard="2",type="derive"} 18446744073700884979
scylla_reactor_cpu_steal_time_ms{shard="3",type="derive"} 18446744073709528121
# HELP scylla_reactor_fstream_read_bytes Counts bytes read from disk file streams.  A high rate indicates high disk activity. Divide by fstream_reads to determine average read size.
# TYPE scylla_reactor_fstream_read_bytes counter
scylla_reactor_fstream_read_bytes{shard="0",type="derive"} 57628
scylla_reactor_fstream_read_bytes{shard="1",type="derive"} 141367
scylla_reactor_fstream_read_bytes{shard="2",type="derive"} 556998
scylla_reactor_fstream_read_bytes{shard="3",type="derive"} 264777
# HELP scylla_reactor_fstream_read_bytes_blocked Counts the number of bytes read from disk that could not be satisfied from read-ahead buffers, and had to block. Indicates short streams, or incorrect read ahead configuration.
# TYPE scylla_reactor_fstream_read_bytes_blocked counter
scylla_reactor_fstream_read_bytes_blocked{shard="0",type="derive"} 57628
scylla_reactor_fstream_read_bytes_blocked{shard="1",type="derive"} 141367
scylla_reactor_fstream_read_bytes_blocked{shard="2",type="derive"} 556998
scylla_reactor_fstream_read_bytes_blocked{shard="3",type="derive"} 264777
# HELP scylla_reactor_fstream_reads Counts reads from disk file streams.  A high rate indicates high disk activity. Contrast with other fstream_read* counters to locate bottlenecks.
# TYPE scylla_reactor_fstream_reads counter
scylla_reactor_fstream_reads{shard="0",type="counter"} 9
scylla_reactor_fstream_reads{shard="1",type="counter"} 32
scylla_reactor_fstream_reads{shard="2",type="counter"} 128
scylla_reactor_fstream_reads{shard="3",type="counter"} 60
# HELP scylla_reactor_fstream_reads_ahead_bytes_discarded Counts the number of buffered bytes that were read ahead of time and were discarded because they were not needed, wasting disk bandwidth. Indicates over-eager read ahead configuration.
# TYPE scylla_reactor_fstream_reads_ahead_bytes_discarded counter
scylla_reactor_fstream_reads_ahead_bytes_discarded{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_reactor_fstream_reads_ahead_bytes_discarded{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_reactor_fstream_reads_ahead_bytes_discarded{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_reactor_fstream_reads_ahead_bytes_discarded{shard="3",type="derive"} 0
# HELP scylla_reactor_fstream_reads_aheads_discarded Counts the number of times a buffer that was read ahead of time and was discarded because it was not needed, wasting disk bandwidth. Indicates over-eager read ahead configuration.
# TYPE scylla_reactor_fstream_reads_aheads_discarded counter
scylla_reactor_fstream_reads_aheads_discarded{shard="0",type="counter"} 0
scylla_reactor_fstream_reads_aheads_discarded{shard="1",type="counter"} 0
scylla_reactor_fstream_reads_aheads_discarded{shard="2",type="counter"} 0
scylla_reactor_fstream_reads_aheads_discarded{shard="3",type="counter"} 0

scylla_storage_proxy_replica_cross_shard_ops{shard="1",type="total_operations"} 20

scylla_storage_proxy_replica_cross_shard_ops{shard="3",type="total_operations"} 30

# HELP scylla_tracing_cached_records Holds a number of tracing records cached in the tracing sessions that are not going to be written in the next write event. If sum of this metric, pending_for_write_records and flushing_records is close to 11000 we are likely to start dropping tracing records.
# TYPE scylla_tracing_cached_records gauge
scylla_tracing_cached_records{shard="0",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_tracing_cached_records{shard="1",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_tracing_cached_records{shard="2",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_tracing_cached_records{shard="3",type="gauge"} 0.000000
# HELP scylla_tracing_dropped_records Counts a number of dropped records due to too many pending records. High value indicates that backend is saturated with the rate with which new tracing records are created.
# TYPE scylla_tracing_dropped_records counter
scylla_tracing_dropped_records{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_tracing_dropped_records{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_tracing_dropped_records{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_tracing_dropped_records{shard="3",type="derive"} 0
# HELP scylla_tracing_dropped_sessions Counts a number of dropped sessions due to too many pending sessions/records. High value indicates that backend is saturated with the rate with which new tracing records are created.
# TYPE scylla_tracing_dropped_sessions counter
scylla_tracing_dropped_sessions{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_tracing_dropped_sessions{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_tracing_dropped_sessions{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_tracing_dropped_sessions{shard="3",type="derive"} 0
# HELP scylla_tracing_flushing_records Holds a number of tracing records that currently being written to the I/O backend. If sum of this metric, cached_records and pending_for_write_records is close to 11000 we are likely to start dropping tracing records.
# TYPE scylla_tracing_flushing_records gauge
scylla_tracing_flushing_records{shard="0",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_tracing_flushing_records{shard="1",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_tracing_flushing_records{shard="2",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_tracing_flushing_records{shard="3",type="gauge"} 0.000000
# HELP scylla_tracing_keyspace_helper_bad_column_family_errors Counts a number of times write failed due to one of the tables in the system_traces keyspace has an incompatible schema. One error may result one or more tracing records to be lost. Non-zero value indicates that the administrator has to take immediate steps to fix the corresponding schema. The appropriate error message will be printed in the syslog.
# TYPE scylla_tracing_keyspace_helper_bad_column_family_errors counter
scylla_tracing_keyspace_helper_bad_column_family_errors{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_tracing_keyspace_helper_bad_column_family_errors{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_tracing_keyspace_helper_bad_column_family_errors{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_tracing_keyspace_helper_bad_column_family_errors{shard="3",type="derive"} 0
# HELP scylla_tracing_keyspace_helper_tracing_errors Counts a number of errors during writing to a system_traces keyspace. One error may cause one or more tracing records to be lost.
# TYPE scylla_tracing_keyspace_helper_tracing_errors counter
scylla_tracing_keyspace_helper_tracing_errors{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_tracing_keyspace_helper_tracing_errors{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_tracing_keyspace_helper_tracing_errors{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_tracing_keyspace_helper_tracing_errors{shard="3",type="derive"} 0
# HELP scylla_tracing_pending_for_write_records Holds a number of tracing records that are going to be written in the next write event. If sum of this metric, cached_records and flushing_records is close to 11000 we are likely to start dropping tracing records.
# TYPE scylla_tracing_pending_for_write_records gauge
scylla_tracing_pending_for_write_records{shard="0",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_tracing_pending_for_write_records{shard="1",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_tracing_pending_for_write_records{shard="2",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_tracing_pending_for_write_records{shard="3",type="gauge"} 0.000000

# HELP scylla_transport_requests_blocked_memory Holds an incrementing counter with the requests that ever blocked due to reaching the memory quota limit (12373196B). The first derivative of this value shows how often we block due to memory exhaustion in the "CQL transport" component.
# TYPE scylla_transport_requests_blocked_memory counter
scylla_transport_requests_blocked_memory{shard="0",type="derive"} 0
scylla_transport_requests_blocked_memory{shard="1",type="derive"} 0
scylla_transport_requests_blocked_memory{shard="2",type="derive"} 0
scylla_transport_requests_blocked_memory{shard="3",type="derive"} 0
# HELP scylla_transport_requests_blocked_memory_current Holds the number of requests that are currently blocked due to reaching the memory quota limit (12373196B). Non-zero value indicates that our bottleneck is memory and more specifically - the memory quota allocated for the "CQL transport" component.
# TYPE scylla_transport_requests_blocked_memory_current gauge
scylla_transport_requests_blocked_memory_current{shard="0",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_transport_requests_blocked_memory_current{shard="1",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_transport_requests_blocked_memory_current{shard="2",type="gauge"} 0.000000
scylla_transport_requests_blocked_memory_current{shard="3",type="gauge"} 0.000000
